DataElement.preferredName: Hepatitis B Hepatitis C Infection Personal Medical History Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable response regarding whether the patient has evidence of active Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) or Hepatitis C Virus (HCV).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hepatitis B Hepatitis C Infection Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An individual's account of a history of Hepatitis B or C infection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A viral hepatitis caused by the Hepatitis B virus.:An RNA virus, causes non-A and non-B Hepatitis and liver cancer:A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.
A viral infection caused by the hepatitis C virus.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Property.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) or Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have active Hepa
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active Hepatitis B Virus (HBV), or Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) infection (patient with chronic or cleared HBV and HCV infection are eligible)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active Hepatitis B (e.g., HBsAg reactive) or Hepatitis C (e.g., HCV RNA [qualitative] is detected)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of Hepatitis B Virus (HBV), or Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) infection (patients with chronic or cleared HBV and HCV infection are eligible)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a positive test for hepatitis B virus surface antigen (HBV sAg) or hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV antibody) indicating acute or chronic infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study hepatitis B virus surface antigen (HBV sAg) or hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV antibody) positive, indicating acute or chronic infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient had a hepatitis virus infection (Hepatitis B or Hepatitis C), have they been definitively treated for 6 months, have no detectable viral load on quantitative PCR, and do liver function tests  (LFTs) meet eligibility requirements?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient tested positive for hepatitis B virus surface antigen (HBV sAg) or hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV antibody) indicating acute or chronic infection, unless the viral load by PCR is undetectable with/without active treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a positive test for hepatitis B virus surface antigen (HBV sAg) or hepatitis C antibody (HCV Ab)/RNA (HCV RNA) indicating acute or chronic infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known Hepatitis B Virus (HBV), or Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) infection (patient with chronic or cleared HBV and HCV infection are eligible)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of active Hepatitis B and/or Hepatitis C infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has Hepatitis C (both reactive anti-HCV antibody and detectable HCV RNA) and Hepatitis B (HBsAg positive and anti-HBc-Total positive), is total bilirubin: greater than 1.5 × institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) and AST (SGOT) /ALT (SGPT): greater than 2.5 X institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active hepatitis, type B or C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient's serologic status reflect active hepatitis B or C infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have untreated or active Hepatitis B or C infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) or Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known serologic status reflect active hepatitis B or C infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active infection, including hepatitis B (known positive HBV surface antigen (HBsAg) result) or, hepatitis C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known acute or chronic active hepatitis B or hepatitis C infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient known to have acute or chronic active hepatitis B or hepatitis C infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known history of Hepatitis B Virus (HBV), or Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) infection (patients with chronic or cleared HBV and HCV infection are eligible)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Positive Hepatitis B Surface Antigen (HepBsAg) (indicative of chronic Hepatitis B), positive Hepatitis total core antibody with negative HBsAG(suggestion of occult Hepatitis B), or detectable Hepatitis C virus RNA by a polymerase-chain reaction (PCR) assay (indicative of active Hepatitis C - screening is generally done by Hepatitis C Antibody (HepCAb), followed by Hepatitis C virus RNA by PCR if HepCAb is positive)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active Hepatitis B Virus (HBV; HepBsAG positive and IgM anti-HBc), or Hepatitis C Virus (HCV; detectable HCV RNA) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active hepatitis (i.e. hepatitis B or hepatitis C)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Positive Hepatitis B Surface Antigen (HepBsAg) (indicative of chronic Hepatitis B), positive Hepatitis total core antibody with negative HBsAG (suggestive of occult hepatitis B), or detectable Hepatitis C virus RNA by a polymerase-chain reaction (PCR) assay (indicative of active Hepatitis C - screening is generally done by Hepatitis C Antibody (HepCAb), followed by Hepatitis C virus RNA by PCR if HepCAb is positive)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active infection with Hepatitis B Virus (HBV), or Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) (patients with chronic or cleared HBV and HCV infection are eligible)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active hepatitis B or C virus infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active Hepatitis B (e.g., HBsAg reactive) or Hepatitis C (e.g., HCV quantitative PCR is detected)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active Hepatitis B (e.g., HBsAg reactive) or active Hepatitis C (e.g., HCV quantitative PCR is detected)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known history of Hepatitis B (defined as Hepatitis B surface antigen [HBsAg] reactive) or known active Hepatitis C virus (defined as detectable HCV RNA) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have hepatitis B (HBV) or hepatitis C (HCV) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is seropositive for HBV and/or HCV, are HBV and/or HCV viral load undetectable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active hepatitis (i.e. hepatitis B or hepatitis C) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active hepatitis (i.e. hepatitis B or hepatitis C) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active hepatitis B (e.g., HBsAG reactive) or C virus (e.g., HCV RNA (quantitative) is detected) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active hepatitis (i.e., Hepatitis B or C)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the HBV viral load undetectable on suppressive therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known history of Hepatitis B (defined as Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) reactive) or known active hepatitis C virus (defined as HCV RNA [qualitative] is detected) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known history of Hepatitis B (defined as Hepatitis B surface antigen [HBsAg] reactive) or known active Hepatitis C virus (defined as HCV RNA [qualitative] is detected) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active or prior history of hepatitis B or C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Hepatitis B (HBV) or Hepatitis C (HCV) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the viral load testing negative?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active hepatitis B (positive HBV surface antigen (HBsAg) result) or hepatitis C (HCV)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active Hepatitis B (HBV) or Hepatitis C (HCV) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient satisfy all of the hepatitis B and/or Hepatitis C criteria specified in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active HBV or HCV infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 42
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known history of Hepatitis B (defined as HBsAg reactive) or known active Hepatitis C virus (defined as HCV RNA [qualitative] is detected) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 43
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) or Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 44
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active hepatitis B (e.g. hepatitis B virus [HBV] surface antigen [HBsAg] reactive) or hepatitis C (e.g. hepatitis C virus [HCV] ribonucleic acid [RNA] [qualitative] is detected)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 45
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a positive test for hepatitis B virus surface antigen (HBV sAg) or hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) indicating acute or chronic infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 46
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active hepatitis B (e.g., HBsAg reactive) or hepatitis C?
